alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 1:01PM MST until January 05 at 6:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Periods of moderate to heavy snow. Current snowfall accumulations stand between 4 to 6 inches. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are possible. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Isolated higher amounts are possible in the highest elevations of the Sacramento Mountains this evening and overnight. Snowfall will be diminishing through the night hours with some lingering light snow in the morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
